sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Europe braces for upheaval with May Day protests expected to bring several nations to a halt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than one million people could hit the streets in France over the country's contentious pension reform. And this May Day, also known as International Workers' Day, will mark the 13th mobilization against a plan that's raising the minimum retirement age from 62 to 64.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Portugal, demonstrations are expected over climate change, housing prices, the cost of living and teachers' pay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of teachers took to the street last month to call for better working conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Greece, protests over a train accident that killed 57 people in February will be back in full force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The accident exposed gaps in the state's public service, and many blame the government for the accident that mainly killed young students.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: First in May, trade union parades will also take place to a lesser or greater extent in every country in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been handing out medals as a widely expected counter-offensive approaches.

The invasion of Ukraine, the world's breadbasket, has sent the world grain markets into panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Today's stabilized prices remain high, around 250 to 300 euros per tonne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A heavy price to pay for countries that depend on imports for their food security. Les grandes zones d'achat aujourd'hui dans le monde, ce sont le Moyen-Orient, l'Afrique du Nord, l'Afrique subsaharienne et l'Asie du Sud-Est.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ces quatre sous-régions font deux tiers, voire 70% chaque année de l'importation mondiale de blé.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Si vous êtes l'Algérie, le Nigeria, vous avez de la manne pétrolière qui vous permet éventuellement d'acheter un peu plus cher ce blé.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Là où la Tunisie, le Mali ou le Soudan, pour prendre des pays qui aujourd'hui sont particulièrement instables, ont des difficultés à payer ce blé plus cher sur le marché international.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mais cette balance relative se déroule par un thread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: La sécurité de la passage des chèvres uk Ukrainian wheat chips through the Black Sea this transit has been guaranteed since July by an initiative brokered by the UN and Turkey it has already been called into question twice in November and March each time when there is a discussion around is the agreement going to be renewed or not prices become volatile volatile again volatility is bad for consumers above all in poor countries and in poor households.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia is using the agreement as a means of pressure to lift economic sanctions imposed by the West. If its demands are not met by May 18, it will not sign the agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The package deal was extended up to May 18 in order to encourage the UN and resolve five systematic problems blocking domestic agricultural exports, Russian exports. But the sea is not the only way out for Ukrainian grain. The European Union has opened its roads, rails and ports to Kyiv wheat. This measure has been questioned by Eastern European farmers. Over the past year, some 30 million tonnes of grain have left Ukraine by land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It is a real security for Ukraine. It is also a security for a certain number of countries buyers in the world that volumes can pass through Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While Russia and Ukraine play a major role in the grain market, they are not alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Importing countries could also count on China, the United States, Canada or India.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If there's something positive that we have seen in this crisis is that those other producers can buffer off a lot of what happens in individual countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Turkish presidential elections are just two weeks away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And after reports of a health scare, Recep Tayyip Erdogan is back on the main stage and facing the most hotly contested race of his tenure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Early polls show the two main candidates are neck and neck.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The current head of state and power for the last 20 years faces rival Kemal Kilic Derolyaru from the secular and social democratic People's Republican Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both attended huge rallies this Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the capital Ankara, Erdogan promised that with God's help he would destroy the opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Erdogan, who was prime minister from 2003 to 2014 and president since then, faces a competitor who is trying to captivate the young electorate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In all, 5.2 million youths are eligible to vote for the first time, a generation hungry for change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, only one-fifth of 18 to 25-year-olds are expected to vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kilic Duraluru leads a six-party coalition and has vowed to, quote, bring back the light to Turkey and rebuild Turkish democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: and has vowed to, quote, bring back the light to Turkey and rebuild Turkish democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Counting has begun after a referendum in Uzbekistan that, if passed,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: would allow the current president to stay in power until 2040.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The extension of presidential terms from five to seven years was one of several reforms to the constitution on the ballot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Polls indicate President Zhavkat Mezioryev is almost certain to win the public's backing for the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Other amendments include abolishing capital punishment and boosting legal protections for citizens. Turnout was reported to have passed the required 50 percent threshold.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A man has shot three people dead before turning the gun on himself, Portuguese police said on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Local media described it as a dispute among rival pigeon racers in the city of Setubal, south of Lisbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The four had been taking part in a pigeon race when they fell into disagreement about an illegal vegetable garden, Portuguese media reported from the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Though Portugal has restrictive gun laws, some firearms are permitted for hunting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Of around 80 murders per year on average in the country, about a fifth are shootings.

sentences.sentence: More than 2,000 journalists, lawmakers and celebrities gathered in Washington for its

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: annual White House Correspondents' Dinner. And its main course, jokes about President Joe Biden's age.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One comedian mocked Biden for running for second term in the White House, saying that while in France, people are rioting because they don't want to work until 64, in the U.S., they are begging to work until their mid-80s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The dinner is meant to celebrate press freedom and freedom of speech and usually involves roasting the country's sitting president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iconic Russian fashion designer Slava Zetesev has died aged 85. Affectionately known as the Soviet Christian Dior, the courtier was reportedly taken to hospital with stomach bleeding and died at the intensive care unit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Heralded as an innovator who wasn't afraid of bold experiments, his striking and colorful designs were sported at countless fashion weeks through the decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Closely watched by the KGB for his contact with Western designers, his dresses were popular with Russian President Vladimir Putin's ex-wife and the wife of former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: SpaceX has successfully launched one of the most powerful rockets in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Falcon Heavy rocket was shot up into orbit from the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida, on Sunday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Its mission? Carry three satellites into orbit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In April, a similar rocket exploded minutes after blasting off, causing it to crash into the Gulf of Mexico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Another test last week pulverized enough concrete to raise concerns about its environmental impact and sparked a fire in a nearby wildlife refuge.
